thread.title: This is what Sir Alex Ferguson thinks about Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho - report
thread.title_full: This is what Sir Alex Ferguson thinks about Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho - report

title: This is what Sir Alex Ferguson thinks about Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho - report
text:
This is what Sir Alex Ferguson thinks about Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho - report SIR ALEX FERGUSON reportedly wishes Manchester United had appointed Jose Mourinho after his retirement in 2013. By Jack Otway PUBLISHED: PUBLISHED: 04:20, Tue, Feb 28, 2017 
Manchester United landed their first trophy under Mourinho with a 3-2 EFL Cup final win over Southampton on Sunday. 
It was just their second piece of major silverware since Ferguson retired in 2013. 
David Moyes took the job immediately after but was sacked in April 2014 with the club finishing seventh. 
Louis van Gaal then followed but, despite winning the FA Cup last season, was axed after two difficult seasons at Old Trafford. Behind-the-scenes pictures as Man United celebrate EFL Cup final win Mon, February 27, 2017 Manchester United players went crazy in their Wembley dressing room after their 3-2 victory over Southampton in the EFL Cup final, having equalled Liverpool's record of 41 major trophies Man Utd via Getty Images 1 of 13 Manchester United stars enjoyed themselves after beating Southampton at Wembley GETTY Jose Mourinho won his first major trophy as Manchester United boss on Sunday GETTY Louis van Gaal was axed despite winning the FA Cup last season 
Mourinho has United on the right track with the club just two points adrift of the top four and still in contention for the FA Cup and Europa League. 
And the Daily Mail claim that Ferguson is ruing the Red Devils' failure to get Mourinho sooner. 
It is claimed the legendary Scot has told former colleagues the former Chelsea boss is the man they have been looking for ever since he left the club. 
Ferguson is also said to admire Mourinho for his boldness when it comes to selecting players and his decision not to chop and change upon succeeding Van Gaal. GETTY Sir Alex Ferguson is reportedly delighted with Jose Mourinho 
The Portuguese picks players depending on how they fare in training rather than on their name or reputation. 
And his decision not to change personnel behind the scenes has also been well-received. 
"It's hindsight, of course, but we really do wish we'd got him three years ago," a source reportedly said. 
"From the receptionist to the chef, it's pretty much all the same staff there." Related articles
